history.content:
In terms of stuff related to ML/DS, EE16B very important to build a linear algebra proof foundation beyond EE16A or MATH 54. It also contributes to your math maturity in proofs related to linear algebra, along with a variety of ML related topics like PCA, Low rank approximation, K-means etc. (In ee16a we covered linear regression, as you can see ee16ab are designed to prepare students for ML)I'd say unless you have taken EECS127 & MATH 110, ee16b would be a good and moderate load preparation for 189. So if you already put 127 or 110 into schedule, I think it totally fine to put it back. Otherwise at least from a lot of my friends doing ML now who took 189 without 110, it's still very helpful to take early.

In terms of robotics, EE16B is very helpful as it covers a breath of topics in control and ML etc.

In terms of stuff related to ML/DS, EE16B very important to build a linear algebra proof foundation beyond EE16A or MATH 54. It also contributes to your math maturity in proofs related to linear algebra. I'd say unless you have taken EECS127 & MATH 110, ee16b would be a good and moderate load preparation for 189. So if you already put 127 or 110 into schedule, I think it totally fine to put it back. Otherwise at least from a lot of my friends doing ML now who took 189 without 110, it's still very helpful to take early.

In terms of robotics, EE16B is very helpful as it covers a breath of topics in control and ML etc.

In terms of stuff related to ML/DS, EE16B very important to build a linear algebra foundation beyond EE16A or MATH 54. It also contributes to your math maturity in proofs related to linear algebra. I'd say unless you have taken EECS127 & MATH 110, ee16b would be a good and moderate load preparation for 189. So if you already put 127 or 110 into schedule, I think it totally fine to put it back. Otherwise at least from a lot of my friends doing ML now who took 189 without 110, it's still very helpful to take early.

In terms of robotics, EE16B is very helpful as it covers a breath of topics in control and ML etc.

I'm considering not taking EE16B until senior year, due to a variety of reasons like workload, professor preferences, and relevance towards towards my academic focus--I'm doing more of a data science/machine learning track. However, I still might take one or two robotics or networking classes later on just to explore, i.e. more EE-inclined classes.

How important is taking 16B early on, in terms of prequisites and helpfulness in getting an internship?
history.subject: Save EE16B for senior year?
